intro: Hieracium palatinatus, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often reddish in color. Its yellow flowers are arranged in a single inflorescence at the top of the stem, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium palatinatus is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and meadows.
